algebraic_word_problem: John and Mike together have 90 dollars. John has 20 dollars more than Mike. How much does each have?
reference_answer: John has 55 dollars and Mike has 35 dollars
step_by_step_solution:
Let Mike's dollars = x
John's dollars = x + 20
x + (x + 20) = 90
2x + 20 = 90
2x = 70
x = 35
John = 55, Mike = 35
